item.title: 科研那点破事
item.description: 套 取 下午,同办公室的西班牙裔A君哭丧着脸说：“没想到S是这么不要脸的人。”。详细问了缘由，原来她刚收到老板转抄的邮件。本系的S教授手下的一个

item.title: 回归学术
item.description: 陪女儿玩完，无意间打开谷歌学术，其首页“最新论文推荐”的第一条有点似曾相识。仔细看一作者正是Cylir在2015年指导的那名法国学生，文章发

item.title: 论文修改之困
item.description: 记得2014年刚到西班牙不久,跟Cyril聊过博士毕业后产出下降问题。当时我非常难以理解他的状态，而他说，等你毕业了就知道了。我自己情况现在

item.title: Leah is 100 days old
item.description: My daughter, Leah, is a hundred days old today. Coincidentally, my new website went live today. However, I don’t have time to write a commemorative blog for her, although I know that the 100 first days is very important in traditional Chinese culture. Then I just put a picture of Leah here as a marker.

item.title: 女儿一百天了
item.description: 这是我第一次尝试静态站。巧合的是网站上线的第一天也是女儿出生的第100天。只是很遗憾这个博文，是为了给网站放上一个测试页面。现在实在还有太多

item.title: 学生最新JXB文章

item.title: About Me
item.description: I am Dongliang Xiong, a Postdoctoral Fellow in Tom Buckley’s lab, UC Davis. Contact Information E-mail: dlxiong@mail.hzau.edu.cn / dlxiong@ucdavis.edu Twitter: Apricot0627 Current Address: Department of Plant Sciences, University of California, Davis, CA 95616, USA Please feel free to contact me if you are interested in collaborating. Education and Work experience 2017.12-present：Post-doc, University of California, Davis 2017.10-2017.12：Post-doc, The University of Sydney 2016.12-2017.09：Post-doc, Huazhong Agricultural University 2014.11-2016.11：Ph.D./Visiting researcher, Universitat de les Illes Balears, Spain

item.title: Publications
item.description: My Google Scholar, Web of Science, Scopus & ORCID 2018 12 Xiaoxiao Wang#, Tingting Du#, Jianliang Huang, Shaobing Peng and Dongliang Xiong. Leaf hydraulic vulnerability triggers the decline in stomatal and mesophyll conductance during drought in rice (Oryza sativa). Journal of Experimental Botany (online) (#co-first authors) 11 Xiaoxiao Wang, Wenchang Wang, Jianliang Huang, Shaobing Peng & Dongliang Xiong. (2018) Diffusional conductance to CO2 is the key limitation to photosynthesis in salt-stressed leaves of rice (Oryza sativa) Physiologia Plantarum.

item.title: Research
item.description: They were copied from my old website. I will update oneday The responses of leaf morphological and physiological traits to environmental changes. Leaf is one of the most sensitive organs to environmental factors including abiotic and biotic stresses. Typically, leaves adjust leaf anatomy, leaf mass per area (LMA), and leaf nitrogen content (N) to environmental variables. However, these adjustments will potentially impact the leaf carbon accumulation and then plants performance.

item.title: 关于我
item.description: 一位正在加州大学戴维斯分校从事博士后研究的科研狗父亲。女儿认为我陪的时间太少（至少她娘一直是这样说的），领导们又觉得我每天工作时间太短。我的
